situation.title: Actual situation
text: My name is Corentin BEAL, I'm currently studying computer programming and a little computer science in SUPINFO Lyon. I'm more interested in software and website development than system administration and I am currently looking for an internship to end my third year at Supinfo between the 1st July and the 31st October 2016.

I like to keep an eye on and experiment with new development language, library or framework and this is why I always try to keep a side project to work on along my usual school courses and assignments. You can find the majority of my work, either project or assignment, on my Github page.

item.text: Language C/C++, SDL and Irrlicht library
Java, Swing library and Android development
C# language, WPF, LINQ and .NET platform
Search engine optimization and Google Analytics usage
Configuration and usage of the Linux systems
Basic Cisco switch/router setup and configuration
Professional working proficiency (ILR), certified B2 Cambridge
Advanced usage of Netbeans IDE for C/C++ and Java development
Basic usage of the Jetbrains suite (WebStorm, PyCharm, ...)
Experimented with Git and Mercurial version control systems

school.name: SUPINFO
description: I started Supinfo in 2013 and I achieved the second year of my bachelor degree this year. During those years I had the opportunity to learn algorithmic and programming with a large variety of language, platform and pattern (OOP, test-driven, ...)
I was also introduced to system administration with Cisco technologies, Linux platform and basic Microsoft Server configuration.

school.name: ESCY
description: I graduated from french high-school, Lycée, and obtained my Baccalauréat S with honor in 2013. The Baccalauréat is the french diploma that ends high school, the 'S' stands for scientific and means that this streams is focused toward scientific subject as biology, chemistry , physics.
I also took an european option that allowed me to travel to England and Germany but also to take history classes in english.

I took an internship last year at MuTest, a company that designs and produces automated tester for electronic component as flash memory or RAM. I worked on the software used by the customers to interact with the testers.

During my first internship I was in charge of regression testing the release before sending them to the customers. On the software part, I added an easy and custom export/import function from/to CSV to an already existing C++ API and improved the test time tracking mechanism in the core C++ application. I modified an existing tool to simplify debugging test program, created by customer, on the graphical side developed in Java with the Swing library.

For my second internship, I have been assigned the task to add a new debug tool to the existing ones in the Java interface. The main focus is to allow customers to easily see the values directly from the tester in a user friendly way to allow them to figure out if their program worked as they intended or better understand the tested component.

I worked at Oriol & Fontanel, a ribbon manufacturer, as a summer job that was not related to my field of study. I was in charge of monitoring the ribbon making machine and picking up the production to pass it on the next manufacturing steps.
I worked at Granger as a packer. I monitored the plastic producing machines and packed the produced bags or plastic films.

I like to travel and discover new cultures. I went 3 weeks in Germany near Munich as an exchange student to study and share the life of my german pen pal in December 2011. I attended the same courses as him and even discovered the famous german Christmas markets.

In March 2012, I took part in another exchange program with an american student in Chicago, USA. I spent 3 weeks attending courses and living in with my american student's family, I even visited downtown Chicago during weekends.
I already said in the quick description that I follow software and platform innovation but to be more precise, I like the novelty aspect of them and the new opportunity that they bring.
I think Polymer 1.0 is a forestate for the future web by using web components and I am very eager to experiemnt with new platform on mobile, Android L/M, or desktop with Windows 10

As I said in my quick description I like software innovation but I follow the hardware ones too. I am particularly interested in wearables technologies like Android Wear and the possibilities it brings.
I also like to pay attention to the quick evolution of virtual reality and more widely used technologies as SSD or processors (x86 and ARM).
